name: 中級英語聽講（一）
restrict: ◎必須先修過【ENU0279  英語聽講（一）】、【ENU0280  英語聽講（二）】
description: This course is designed to cultivate students’ listening skills on natural and real-life English, from a variety of sources like TV news, radio broadcasts, and simulated daily conversations. The course materials mainly comprise a series of videos that provides students with the training of listening skills on public speeches in authentic TV news programs. The course also adopts supplementary materials focusing on less formal English in order to familiarize students with the language spoken in various settings. Students will be encouraged to pay close attention to the native speaker’s intonation and accent, diction and content, and to take notes of the addresses or conversations before they engage in class discussion.
goals: to improve students’ listening comprehension on authentic materials
expose students to natural English, spoken by a wide variety of people from diverse backgrounds and age groups
syllabus:
**Objectives**: This course is designed to **cultivate student listening skills** on natural and real-life English, from a variety of sources like TV news, radio broadcasts, and simulated daily conversations. In so doing, there will be **a four-pronged approach** to the course:

**1)** Firstly, **the course textbook** is designed to improve listening comprehension skills for academic purposes while focusing on listening to general news interest topics in English.

**2)** Secondly, occasionally there will also be **supplementary materials**. These will vary over a range of popular areas so that students can to familiarize themselves with the language spoken in various realistic settings.  

**3)** Thirdly, there will be **a task-based project** element to the course, whereby the student groups will be able to investigate areas and topics that are of interest to them, and then present their work to the class.

**4)** Finally, there will also be **a Mooc online workshop** in the second half of the course whereby students will be asked to do an online course in English of their choice within their area of study or interest.

**5)** **Autonomous Listening Practice:** Students should **practice listening and speaking** outside of class every chance they get. Indeed, any significant English-language listening encounters should be recorded and handed in for grading at the end of the semester.

**N.B. All five elements** to the course **will be evaluated and assessed** when calculating the final grade.

**Guidelines and Requirements: The Rules!**

1\. Punctual attendance is required. Being on time is polite. **Talk to or email me** if you can’t attend class.

**2\. Actively participate** in class discussions.

3\. This is a **Flip Class**. **Homework must be done** for the class to work properly. This includes **reviewing** and **previewing** class chapters.

4\. You need to **submit** assignments **_five times_** during the semester.

**5\. All assignments** must be done and be **on time**.

**6\. Smartphones**, tablets, etc, must be **turned off** unless needed in class.

**7\. No eating** during class, but **drinks are allowed.**

**Grading Policy****:** **The Business!**

**Final Grades** will be given based on student performances in these areas:

1\. Attendance/Participation: 10%

2\. Homework/Classroom assignments (including online textbook exercises): 40%

3\. Listening Presentation Task: 20%

4\. MOOC Online Course Work: 15%

5\. Autonomous Listening Practice: 15%
